field.name: Take Action: Eye Swollen and Draining Pus
Refer mother and baby to the health facility to be treated by a midwife or doctor
Wash your hands with soap and water, then wear gloves
Clear baby’s eyes with a clean cotton swab dipped lightly in normal saline solution. Start from the nose bridge and wipe out. Use one cotton swab per wipe to prevent infection
Teach mother how to keep the baby warm on the way to the health facility
Record baby’s clinical information in client’s maternal health or “Red” book. If possible, also fill out referral form
Have a family member accompany mother and baby to the health facility
Follow up in 2 days after client is discharged from the health facility
